messages.content:
Lucy went to the grocery store. She bought 12 packs of cookies and 16 packs of noodles.
How many packs of groceries did she buy in all?

Roden went to a pet shop. He bought 15 gold fish and 7 blue fish.
How many fish did he buy?

I read 21 pages of my English book yesterday. Today, I read 17 pages.
What is the total number of pages did I read?

In a school, there are 542 girls and 387 boys.
How many pupils are there in that school?

Linda has 34 candies. Chloe has 28.
How many candies do they have in all?

Jose has 28 chickens and 18 ducks.
How many fowls does he have?

Gino has 63 popsicle sticks. I have 50 popsicle sticks.
What is the sum of our popsicle sticks?

Lino picked up 292 shells at the seashore in the morning and 324 shells in the afternoon.
How many shells did he pick up in all?

There were 105 parents in the program and 698 pupils, too.
How many people were present in the program?

Last Saturday, Marie sold 425 magazines and 275 newspapers.
What is the total number of reading materials she sold?

There are twelve birds on the fence. Eight more birds land on the fence.
How many birds are on the fence?

Twenty-two boys went down the slide. Thirteen more boys went down the slide.
How many boys went down the slide?

Thirteen ducks are swimming in a lake. Twenty more ducks come to join them.
How many ducks are swimming in the lake?

Thirty dogs are barking. Ten more dogs start to bark.
How many dogs are barking?

Bobby ate twenty-six pieces of candy. Then, he ate seventeen more.
How many pieces of candy did Bobby eat?

Sandy had twenty-six pet fish. She bought six more fish.
How many pet fish does Sandy have now?

The clown blew up forty-seven balloons. Then he blew up thirteen more balloons.
How many balloons does the clown have now?

Our class got fifty-four books from the library. Then we got twenty-three more books from the library.
How many books did our class get from the library?

Tessa has 4 apples. Anita gave her 5 more. She needs 10 apples to make a pie.
Does she have enough to make a pie?
4+5=9 apples < 10 apples

Julia played tag with 12 kids on Monday. She played tag with 7 kids on Tuesday.
How many kids did she play with altogether?

Molly had 14 candles on her birthday cake. She grew older and got 6 more on her birthday cake.
How old is Molly now?

James ate 22 carrot sticks before dinner and 15 more after dinner.
How many carrot sticks did he eat?

Charles found 6 pennies on his way to school. He also had 3 nickels already at home.
How much money does he now have in all?
6 (penny)*1 (cent/penny) + 3 (nickel)*5 (cent/nickel) = 21 (cent)

Jovana filled her bucket with 5 pounds of shells. If she adds 12 more pounds of shell to fill her bucket,
how many pounds does she have?

Jovana filled her bucket with 5 pounds of shells. If a friend comes to add 15 pounds of shells, and another friend comes to add 17 pounds of shells,
how many pounds does she have altogether?

Isha's pencil is 12 cubes long. If she gets another pencil that is 12 cubes long,
how many cubes long are both pencils?

Isabella's hair is 18 cubes long. She gets hair extensions and it doubles her length.
How much hair does she have now?

Isabella's hair is 18 cubes long. If her hair grows 4 more inches,
how long will it be?

Mrs. Sheridan has 17 cats. Mr. Sheridan gave her 14 more cats.
How many cats does Mrs. Sheridan have altogether?

Mrs. Sheridan has 22 fish. Her sister gave her 47 more fish.
How many fish does she have now?

Mrs. Heine is buying Valentine's Day treats for her 2 dogs. If she wants to buy them 3 heart biscuits each,
how many biscuits does she need to buy?

Mrs. Heine is buying Valentine's Day treats for her 2 dogs. If she wants to buy them 5 heart biscuits each and a set of puppy boots each,
how many items will she buy?

Cade had 87 marbles. He gave 8 to Dylan.
How many does he have left?

Michael has some fish in his fish tank. Ben gave him 18 more fish. Now he has 49.
How many fish did he have to begin with?

Daniel had some noodles. He gave 12 noodles to William. Now Daniel only has 54 noodles.
How many noodles did Daniel have to begin with?

Hayley had 25 meatballs on her plate. Kirsten stole some of her meatballs. Now she has 11 meatballs on her plate.
How many meatballs did Kirsten steal?

Isabella's hair is 18 inches long. If she gets a haircut and now her hair is 9 inches long,
how much of Isabella's hair got cut off?

Isabella's hair is 18 inches long. By the end of the year her hair is 24 inches long.
How much hair did she grow?

Jovana had 5 pounds of shells in her bucket. She added some shells and now has 28 pounds of shells.
How many pounds did she add?

Isha's pencil is 31 inches long. If she sharpens it, now her pencil is 14 inches long.
How much did she sharpen off of her pencil?

Isha's pencil is 22 inches long. If she sharpens two inches off on Monday and two inches on Tuesday,
how long will her pencil be then?

Mrs. Sheridan has 11 cats.
How many more cats does Mrs. Sheridan need to have 43 cats?

Mrs. Wong had 30 Valentines. She gave 8 Valentines to her children.
How many does she have left?

Mrs. Franklin had 58 Valentines. Mrs. Franklin gave some to her students. Now she has 16.
How many Valentines did Mrs. Franklin give to her students?

Mrs. Snyder made 86 heart cookies. She made 36 red cookies and the rest are pink.
How many pink cookies did she make?

29 birds were sitting in a tree. Some more fly up to the tree. Then there were 42 birds in the tree.
How many more flew up to the tree?

18 children were riding on the bus. At the bus stop, some more children got on the bus. Then there were 25 children altogether on the bus.
How many children got on the bus at the bus stop?

There were 28 girls and 35 boys on the playground at recess.
How many children were there in all?

The elephant had 407 peanuts. She ate 129 of them.
How many peanuts did the elephant have left?

There were 58 geese and 37 ducks in the marsh.
How many birds were there in all?

Robin had 18 pieces of gum. Her brother gave her some more pieces. Now Robin has 44 pieces in all.
How many pieces of gum did Robin's brother give her?

Tommy had some balloons. His mom gave him 34 more balloons for his birthday. Then, Tommy had 60 balloons.
How many balloons did Tommy have to start with?

Alex had some candles for his Jack O'Lanterns. He used 32 of them. Now he has 12 left.
How many candles did Alex have to start with?

There were 14 kids on the soccer field. 22 kids decided to join in.
Now how many kids are on the soccer field?

Finn has 89 goldfish. 32 of the goldfish die.
How many goldfish are left?

Jane has 28 old, brown sheets of drawing paper and 27 old, yellow sheets of drawing paper.
How many pieces of drawing paper does she have?

Mikey had 356 leaves. Some of her leaves blew away. Now she has 112 leaves left.
How many of her leaves blew away?

Marcus has 210 baseball cards. He has 58 more than Carter.
How many baseball cards does Carter have?

Gavin has 23 shirts. 6 are blue the rest are green.
How many green shirts does Gavin have?

Ethan has 31 presents. Alissa has 22 more than Ethan.
How many presents does Alissa have?

Cindy had 41 pieces of candy. She ate six pieces in the morning, and twelve more pieces in the afternoon.
How many pieces of candy does she have left?

Robert wants to practice goal kicks for soccer. He decides to have 98 kicks before going home from the park. He takes 43 kicks before taking a break to get a drink of water. He then takes another 36 kicks.
How many more kicks does he need to make before he goes home?

Cindy has 105 stickers. She uses 23 stickers. She buys 45 more stickers.
How many stickers does Cindy have now?

Brian has 39 pencils. He gives 18 pencils to a friend. He buys 22 more pencils.
How many pencils does Brian have now?

Karen has 252 markers. Her mother gives her 34 more markers. Karen loses 11 markers.
How many markers does she have now?

On the first day of the week Pat had 39 stickers. Pat earned 22 more during the week.
How many stickers did Pat have at the end of the week?

Kelly had 56 apples.
How many more apples does Kelly need to pick to have 105 apples altogether?

Todd has some gum. Steve gave him 16 more pieces of gum. Now Todd has 54 pieces of gum.
How many pieces did Todd have to start with?

Josh had 142 pencils. He gave 31 pencils to Dorothy.
How many pencils does Josh have left?

Nell collects baseball cards. She had 304 cards. She gave some of her cards to Jeff and now has 276 cards left.
How many cards did Nell give to Jeff?

Sarah had some trucks. She gave 13 to Jeff, and now she has 38 trucks left.
How many trucks did Sarah have to start with?

There are 40 boys and some girls on the playground. There are 117 children altogether.
How many girls are on the playground?

Each CD rack holds 8 CDs. A shelf can hold four racks.
How many total CDs can fit on the shelf?

Carla has some marbles. She bought 134 marbles. Now she has 187 marbles.
How many did she start with?

Paco had 35 cookies. He ate 6 of them.
How many cookies did Paco have left?

Connie has 41 red markers and 64 blue markers.
How many markers does she have altogether?

Joe had fifty toy cars. If he gets twelve more cars,
how many cars will he have then?

Maria had twenty-five pieces of gum. Tommy gave her sixteen more pieces. Luis gave her twenty more pieces.
How many pieces of gum does Maria have now?

There are sixty-four pigs in the barn. Some more come to join them. Now there are eighty-six pigs.
How many pigs came to join them?

Rosa had sixty-seven flowers. Andre gave her some more flowers. Now, Rosa has ninety flowers.
How many flowers did Andre give to Rosa?

Adolfo made a tower with thirty-five blocks. He added some more blocks and now he has sixty-five blocks.
How many did he have to add?

Lucy put sixty-eight shells in her bucket. She found some more shells and now she has eighty-nine shells.
How many more did she find?

Hugo had seventy-nine stickers in his sticker book. He got some more to add to his book and now he has one hundred-twenty stickers.
How many did he add to his book?

Josh had 16 marbles in his collection. He lost 7 marbles.
How many marbles does he have now?

Megan has 19 seashells.
How many more seashells does she need to find to have 25 seashells in her collection?

Brad has 17 balloons. 8 balloons are red and the rest are green.
How many green balloons does Brad have?

There are 38 books on the shelf. Marta put 10 more books on the shelf.
How many books are on the shelf now?

A bee has 6 legs.
How many legs do 8 bees have?

Mrs. Hilt bought an ice cream cone for 99 cents.
How much would 2 ice cream cones cost?

Mrs. Hilt wants to make a border around her garden. She needs 125 rocks to complete the border. She has 64 rocks.
How many more rocks does she need to complete the border?

Mrs. Hilt had 38 marbles. She lost 15 of them.
How many marbles does she have left?

Mrs. Hilt and her sister drove to a concert 78 miles away. They drove 32 miles and then stopped for gas. Her sister put 28 gallons of gas in the car.
How many miles did they have left to drive?

Mrs. Hilt spent 1 hour and 30 minutes shoveling snow on Saturday morning and 45 minutes shoveling snow on Saturday afternoon.
How much total time did she spend shoveling snow?

Mrs. Hilt bought 6 hot dogs. Each hot dog cost 50 cents.
How much money did she pay for all of the hot dogs?

Mrs. Hilt reads 13 books on every day that starts with the letters T and S.
How many books does she read in one week?

Mrs. Hilt has 50 cents. A pencil costs 5 cents.
How many pencils can she buy with the money she has?

Mrs. Hilt saw 33 butterflies. Some of the butterflies were red and others were orange. If 20 of the butterflies were orange,
how many of them were red?

Mrs. Hilt bought a pencil for 17 cents. She used exactly minimized coins to buy the pencil.
How many coins did she use?

Mrs. Hilt had 43 cents. She bought a pencil for 20 cents and a piece of candy for 5 cents.
How much money did she have left?

On Tuesday, Mrs. Hilt saw 88 raisins on a tray in the cafeteria. That was 8 more raisins than she saw the day before.
How many raisins were on the table on Monday?

Mrs. Hilt bought carnival tickets. The tickets cost $1 for 4 tickets. If Mrs. Hilt bought 12 tickets,
how much did she pay?

Mrs. Hilt bought 3 pizzas for $8 each.
What was the total amount she paid for the three pizzas?

Mrs. Hilt saw 21 snakes, 11 alligators, 36 frogs, and 57 bears.
How many reptiles did Mrs. Hilt see?

The Hawks scored three touchdowns worth 7 points each.
How many points do they have?

I have 28 cents in my pocket.
How coins could I have on minimization?

Zach scored 42 points in the football game. Ben scored 21 points.
How many more points did Zach score?

A game spinner has 5 equal parts. Two parts are blue and three parts are purple.
Which color would you most likely spin?
2 parts(Blue) < 3 parts(Purple)

I have 3 hundreds, 8 tens, and 3 ones.
What number am I?

The puppet show begins at 2:00 p.m. It lasts 1 hour and 30 minutes.
What time does it end?
(2 (hour)*60 (min/hour) + 1 (hour)*60 (min/hour) + 30 (min))/60 (min/hour)=3 r30; hh:mm=3:30 p.m.

John's birthday is January 20th. His sister's birthday comes 14 days later.
When is his sister's birthday?

A quarter equals $0.25.
How many quarters equal $2.25?

Kate has 223 pennies. John has 388 pennies.
How many more pennies does John have?

There are 5 birds in a tree.
How many bird legs do you see?

Two dimes and 3 pennies,
does the former equal the latter?
2*10=20 cents > 1*3=3 cents

There are 3 spiders.
How many spider legs are there?

Karen wants to buy a pen that costs 75 cents. She has 2 quarters and 3 dimes.
Does she have enough money?
2*25+3*10=80 cents > 75 cents

Jeff has twice as many crayons as Joan. Joan has 12 crayons.
How many does Jeff have?

It is 2:00.
What time will it be in three hours and forty-five minutes?
(2 (hour)*60 (min/hour) + 3 (hour)*60 (min/hour) + 45 (min))/60 (min/hour) =5 r45; hh:mm=5:45

Kate gave the clerk $1.00. Her candy cost 54 cents.
How much change should Kate get back?

Mark has 13 trees in his backyard. If he plants 12 more,
how many trees will he have?

Joy will see her grandma in two days.
How many hours until she sees her?

Kim has 4 cousins. She wants to give each one 5 pieces of gum.
How much gum will she need?

Dan has $3.00. He bought a candy bar for $1.00.
How much money is left?

5 boats are in the lake. Each boat has 3 people.
How many people are on boats in the lake?

There are 43 dogs, 72 fish, and 34 cats at my farm.
How many pets do I have at my farm?

Dane eats lunch at 12:30. It takes him 20 minutes to eat.
What time does Dane finish eating?

Kyle has four dimes, one nickel, and one quarter.
Does he have enough to buy a book that costs $1.00?

Charlie has 31 more snowballs than Lucy. She has 19 snowballs.
How many does Charlie have?

Josh had $1.80. He paid 45 cents for a candy car.
How much change will he get?

I have 9 pennies, 4 nickels, and 3 dimes.
How much money do I have?
(9 (penny)*1 (cent/penny) + 4 (nickel)*5 (cent/nickel) + 3 (dime)*10 (cent/dime))/100 (cent/dollar) = 0.59 (dollar)

Randy has 78 blocks. He uses 19 blocks to build a tower.
How many blocks are left?

Hailey's bus is third in line. Danny's bus is 3 buses behind hers.
What place in line is Danny's bus?

Alex has 5 dimes, 4 nickels and one penny.
Does he have enough to buy a hat that costs 90 cents?
50+20+1=71 cents < 90 cents

Gino has 15 brown bears, 24 white bears, and 27 black bears.
How many bears does Gino have?

Rob has seven quarters, three dimes, five nickels, and twelve pennies.
How much money does Rob have?
(7 (quarter)*25 (cent/quarter) + 3 (dime)*10 (cent/dime) + 5 (nickel)*5 (cent/nickel) + 12 (penny)*1 (cent/penny))/100 (cent/dollar) = 2.42 (dollar)

Morgan has 65 red pens, 45 blue pens, and 58 black pens.
How many pens does she have?

Adi bought a pencil for 35 cents. He paid with a one-dollar bill.
How much change will he get?

Rachel is third in line. Julie is 2 spots in front of her.
What place in line is Julie?
Rachel is the 3rd.; 3-1=2 (nd); 3-2=1 (st); Julie is the 1st.

Bryan has 50 skittles. Ben has 20 M&M's.
Who has more?
50 skittles(Bryan) > 20 skittles(Ben)

Bryan has 50 skittles. Ben has 20 M&M's.
How many more does Brian have?

It takes 20 minutes to cook pizza. If Jack wants to eat at 6:30,
what time should he put it in the oven?
((6 (hour)*60 (min/hour) + 30 (min)) - 20 (min))/60 (min/hour) = 6 r10; hh:mm=6:10

It takes 15 minutes for Michael to get to Edgewood. If Michael arrives at 8:30,
what time did Michael leave to get there?
((8 (hour)*60 (min/hour) + 30 (min)) - 15 (min))/60 (min/hour) = 8 r15; hh:mm=8:15

The train left for the station at 9:45 and arrived at 10:00.
How long did it take?
(10*60 (min/hour) - (9*60 (min/hour) + 45 (min))) = 15 (min)

There are 5 boys and 4 girls in a classroom. After 3 boys left the classroom, another 2 girls came in the classroom.
How many children were there in the classroom in the end?

There are 2 red water bottles, 3 black water bottles, and 4 blue water bottles in the fridge. If 5 water bottles are taken out,
how many water bottles are left in the fridge?

At a Halloween store, there are 3 green capes, 2 blue capes, and 3 red capes. If 6 capes are bought,
how many capes are left?

There are 2 green books, 1 blue book, and 4 orange books in a bookshelf. If 3 of them are taken out to be read,
how many books are left on the bookshelf?

There is 1 green bead, 2 brown beads and 3 red beads in a container. Tom took some beads out of the container and left 4 in.
How many beads did Tom take out?

Georgia has 4 yellow buttons, 2 black buttons and 3 green buttons. She gives some of the buttons to Mary, and she has 5 left.
How many buttons did Georgia give to Marry?

There are 2 American people, 4 French people and 4 Chinese people a meeting room. 3 of them leave.
How many people are left the meeting room?

At a candy store, there are 3 brown candy boxes, 3 black candy boxes, and 2 blue candy boxes. If 5 boxes are bought,
how many candy boxes are left?

There are some children at a bakery. As they were deciding what to buy, 24 girls came in and 31 boys left. If there are 78 children in the bakery in the end,
how many children were there at first?

Blithe has a lot of toys. He lost 6 of them and found 9 in his closet. If he had 43 after that,
how many toys did Blithe have at first?

Lena had some pocket money. She lost $4 and her mom gave her $9. If she had $66 after that,
how many dollars did Lena have at first?

There are some passengers on a bus. At a bus stop, 7 more passengers got on the bus and 9 passengers got off. If there are 26 passengers in the bus in the end,
how many passengers were there at first?

Bruno had some story books. He lost 4 of them and his dad gave him 10 more books. If he had 39 books after that,
how many books did Bruno have at first?

There 95 colored lights on a Christmas tree. 26 of them are red, 37 of them are yellow and the rest are blue.
How many blue lights are there on the Christmas tree?

Jacqueline had 16 plums, 18 guavas and 21 apples. She gave some of them to Jane and had 15 fruits left.
How many fruits did Jacqueline give Jane?

There were 36 dogs and 29 cats in a pet center. After 20 of the dogs were adopted by people, the pet center collected another 12 cats.
How many pets were there in the pet center in the end?

Jennifer has an 87 cm long ribbon. She uses 24 cm of the ribbon to tie a present for her friend and 45 cm of the ribbon to make a bow.
How much of the ribbon is left in the end?

There are 54 passengers on a bus. 18 of them are men, 26 of them are women and the rest are children.
How many children are there on the bus?

Bernard had 15 red notebooks, 17 blue notebooks and 19 white notebooks. He gave some of them to Tom and had 5 left.
How many notebooks did Bernard give Tom?

Robert made $76 at work. He spent $6 on a pen and $14 for a calculator.
How much money did he have left?

A shop stocked 22 pairs of large-size shoes, 50 pairs of medium-size shoes and 24 pairs of small-size shoes. After selling some of the shoes, it had 13 pairs of shoes left.
How many pairs of shoes did the shop sell?

There are 100 books on a shelf. 32 of them are history books, 25 of them are geography books and the rest are math books.
How many math books are there on the shelf?

Roger collected 42 pennies, 36 nickels and 15 dimes. He donated some of his coins and had 27 coins left.
How many coins did Roger donate?

A factory produced 50 printers and 21 scanners. After 41 of the printers were sold, it produced another 16 scanners.
How many printers and scanners did the factory have in the end?

Harry walked along the beach and collected 34 sea stars, 21 seashells and 29 snails. He lost some of the items and had 59 items left at the end of his walk.
How many sea creatures did he lose in all?

Georgia had 24 yellow buttons, 16 black buttons and 19 green buttons. She gave some of the buttons to Mary and now Georgia has 13 buttons left.
How many buttons did Georgia give Mary?

There are a total of 90 items at a bakery. 49 of them are bread rolls and 19 of them are croissants.
How many bagels are there?

A pet shop has a total of 77 animals. 32 of them are kittens and 15 of them hamsters, the rest are birds.
How many birds are there?

A restaurant has 94 pieces of cutlery. 38 are forks, 27 are knives, and the rest are spoons.
How many spoons are there?

Debby makes 67 pancakes. She adds blueberries to 20 of them and bananas to 24 of them. The rest are plain.
How many plain pancakes are there?

At a carnival, there are 87 kids, teenagers, and adults waiting to get in. 24 are teenagers, 19 are adults, and the rest are kids.
How many kids are waiting in line at the carnival?

An international group had 49 Chinese, Americans and Australians. 16 of them were Americans and 11 of them were Australians.
How many Chinese were there?

A summer sports camp had 88 soccer campers, basketball campers and football campers. If 24 of them were basketball campers and 32 of them were football campers,
how many soccer campers were there?

67 medals are displayed in the sports center. There are 19 gold medals and 32 silver medals.
How many bronze medals are displayed?

At a store, there are 92 computers. 31 are sold. 20 are shipped away to a company.
How many computers are left?

There were 86 pineapples in a store. The owner sold 48 pineapples. 9 of the remaining pineapples were rotten and thrown away.
How many fresh pineapples are left?

Lenny has $84. He spent $24 on video games, and $21 at the grocery store.
How much does Lenny have left?

There are 96 trees in a park. 15 of them are huge ancient oaks and another 23 of them are medium-sized fir trees. The rest are saplings.
How many saplings are in the park?

There were 86 trees in a park. 15 of them died and another 23 of them were cut.
How many trees were still left?

A mirror store has 78 mirrors in stock. 8 mirrors are broken, and 57 mirrors are sold.
How many mirrors are left?

A restaurant has 67 tomatoes. 32 are made into salads. Another 21 are made into pasta sauce.
How many tomatoes are left?

Ryan collected 89 leaves. He lost 24 leaves. After a while, 43 more leaves broke.
How many leaves are left in his collection?

Kendra took a road trip. In the afternoon, she saw 4 minivans like hers. Later, in the evening, she saw one more minivan like hers.
How many minivans like hers did she see in all?

There are 4 boys and 5 girls in a preschool daycare.
How many children are there in the daycare?

The Vance family walked over to the post office. They bought 2 rooster stamps and 2 daffodil stamps.
How many stamps did they buy in all?

There are 7 basketballs at a school. If the school buys another 3 basketballs,
how many basketballs will the school have?

Garrett went shopping for snack supplies and bought 6 oatmeal raisin granola bars and 8 peanut granola bars.
How many granola bars did he buy in all?

Jack received 8 emails in the morning and 2 emails in the afternoon.
How many emails did Jack receive in the day?

Teacher buys 4 black pens and 4 blue pens for students as awards.
How many pens does the teacher buy altogether?

A chess club has 3 members. If 4 new members are enrolled,
how many total members are there in the chess club?

There are 5 roses and 5 carnations in a vase.
How many flowers are there in the vase in all?

Every day, Ryan spends 4 hours on learning English and 3 hours on learning Chinese.
How many hours does he spend on learning English and Chinese in all?

A number machine changes the value of the numbers placed inside it. My number machine will add 15 to a number and then subtract 6 from the sum. If I put in the number 68,
what number will come out of the machine?

I put another number into my machine. The machine added 15 and then subtracted 6. The number 35 came out of the machine.
What number did I put in?

Caitlin is on the 13th step of a giant slide. She walked down 4 steps to talk to her friend Dana. Then she walked up 12 steps to the top.
How many steps does the giant slide have?

Alyssa had 129 cookies. Aiyanna has 140.
What's the difference of the number of Alyssa's cookies and Aiyanna's cookies?

Mrs. Sheridan has 11 cats. Mrs. Garrett has 24 cats.
What's the difference of the number of Mrs. Sheridan's cats and Mrs. Garrett's cats?

Mrs. Santiago has 58 red roses. Mrs. Garrett has 24.
What's the difference of the number of Mrs. Santiago's red roses and Mrs. Garrett's red roses?

Bobby has 142 books. Kristi has 78 books.
What's the difference of the number of Bobby's books and Kristi's books?

At the arcade Billy had won forty-eight tickets. After buying a yoyo he had thirty-two tickets left.
What's the difference between the number of Billy's tickets he won and he had the left after buying yoyo?

When Maria got to the fair she had $87. When she left she had $16.
What's the difference between the number of dollars when Maria got and left the fair?

Paul spent $75. Now he has $11.
What's the difference between the number of dollars that he spent and he has now?

A chef had forty-six apples. After making some pies he had fourteen left.
What's the difference between the number of apples before the chef made pies and the after the chef making pies?

A pet store had sixty-eight gerbils. If they sold fourteen of them,
what's the difference between the number of gerbils that they had before selling and they sold?

A store has forty-nine shirts. After selling some there were twenty-eight left.
What's the difference between of the number of shirts before selling and after selling?

The Vance family walked over to the post office. They bought 2 rooster stamps and 2 daffodil stamps.
What's the difference between of the number of the two kinds of stamps?

At a bus stop five people got off the bus. Now there were ninety people on the bus.
What's the difference between the number of people getting off the bus and still on the bus?

A fast food restaurant had ninety-one hotdogs. After selling some they had twenty left.
What's the difference between the number of hotdogs before selling and after selling?

Joan is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 7 cups of flour. She already put in 3 cups.
How many more cups does she need to add ?

There were six roses in the vase. Jessica cut some more roses from her flower garden. There are now eighteen roses in the vase.
How many roses did she cut ?

There were eight red roses and two white roses in the vase. Melanie cut some more roses from her flower garden. There are now fourteen red roses in the vase.
How many red roses did she cut ?

Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 9 cups of flour and 3 cups of sugar. She already put in 2 cups of flour.
How many more cups of flour does she need to add ?

Dan's high school played eighteen baseball games this year and two were at night. The team won most of their games. They were defeated during three games.
How many games did they win ?

If you have 1 ten dollar bill, 1 quarter and 1 nickel,
how much money do you have?
(1*10 (dollar) *100 (cent/dollar) + 1 (quarter) *25 (cent/quarter) + 1 (nickel)*5 (cent/nickel))/100 (cent/dollar) = 10.30 (dollar)

If you have 2 quarters, 1 dime and 3 pennies,
how much money do you have?
(2 (quarter)*25 (cent/quarter) + 1 (dime)*10 (cent/dime) + 3 (penny)*1 (cent/penny))/100 (cent/dollar)= 0.63 (dollar)

Mike got twenty-eight GB of space on his disk drive to backup his files. If his files would take up twenty-six GB,
how many GB would he have left?

There are ninety-eight cats in the little town. If ninety-two of them are a asleep, 
how many cats are still awake?

Olivia owned ninety-three pennies. After she bought an apple, she had fifty-six pennies left.
How many did she spend for the apple?

A farmer had ninety-seven tomatoes from his garden. If he picked eighty-three of them,
how many would he have left?

Kaleb had sixty-seven cherries. After eating some, he had forty-two left.
How many cherries did Kaleb eat?

There were ninety-eight onions on the shelf. Sixty-five were sold.
How many onions is there on the shelf now?

Paul had eighty-six books. After selling some in a garage sale he had seventy-eight left.
How many books did he sell?

Olivia had eighty-one pieces of paper in her folder. She used fifty-six pieces.
How many pieces does she have now?

Isabel had some candy. She gave her friend twenty-seven pieces and had sixty-one left.
How many pieces did she have to start with?

When Amy got to the fair she had $15. When she left she had $11.
How much money did she spend at the fair?

While playing a game Kaleb had ninety-eight lives. After losing some lives he had seventy-three left.
How many lives did Kaleb lose?

Maria had sixty-seven pieces of candy. She ate sixty-four pieces.
How many pieces of candy does Maria have now?

A store has forty-nine shirts. After selling some there were twenty-eight left.
How many did they sell?

At the arcade Dave spent forty-three tickets on stuffed tiger. Then he had fifty-five left.
How many tickets did Dave have to start with?

Gwen had ninety-eight DS games. After she gave some to her friends she had ninety-one left.
How many games did she give away?

Billy had seventy-four cherries. He ate seventy-two of them.
How many cherries does Billy have left?

Adam had some quarters. He spent nine of them at the arcade and had seventy-nine left over.
How many quarters did he have to start with?

At a bus stop forty-seven people got off the bus. Now there were forty-three people on the bus.
How many people were on the bus before?

It takes Mike ninety-eight minutes to walk to school. If he rides a bicycle to school, it would save him sixty-four minutes.
How much time did Mike save?

A farmer had forty-six tomatoes from his garden. After picking some he had three left.
How many did he pick?

Carol had ninety-seven pieces of tissue paper. After blowing her nose she had ninety-three left.
How many pieces of tissue paper did she use?

Jerry had caught some butterflies. He let eleven go and now he has eighty-two left.
How many did he originally have?

A chef had forty-six apples. After making some pies he had fourteen left.
How many apples did he use?

For Halloween Oliver got seventy-eight pounds of candy. After giving some to Janet, he had sixty-eight pounds left.
How many pounds did he give to Janet?

There were fifty-eight people on the train. At the next stop forty-five people got off.
How many people are there on the train now?

A fast food restaurant had ninety-nine hotdogs. After selling some they had ninety-seven left.
How many hotdogs did they sell?

John bought some cupcakes for a party. During the party eleven were eaten. Now he has twenty-one left.
How many cupcakes did John get for the party?

Adam needed to climb ninety-six stair steps to reach the rooftop. He already climbed seventy-four.
How many stair steps do left for Adam to climb now?

There were forty-eight people on the train. After the first stop there were thirty-one people left.
How many people got off?

Mike had fifty-one books, but he sold forty-five at a garage sale.
How many books does Mike still have?

A museum had ninety-eight paintings. After they got rid of some, they had ninety-five left.
How many paintings did they get rid of?

Jessie weighted seventy-four kilograms. After she started to go jogging everyday, now she weights sixty-seven kilograms.
How much weight did she lose in the past?

At the arcade Billy had won forty-eight tickets. After buying a yoyo he had thirty-two tickets left.
How many tickets did the yoyo cost?

For a party Adam bought ninety-seven cupcakes. If fifty-eight were eaten,
how many cupcakes would Adam have left?

For a birthday party a clown gave away six balloons. Now he has fifty-five balloons left.
How many balloons did the clown have to start with?

A chef used thirty-nine cherries to make a pie. Now he has fifty-eight cherries left.
How many cherries did he have before he made the pie?

There were ninety-four dollars in Olivia's wallet. After she visited a supermarket, there were seventy-eight dollars left.
How much did she spend?

Winnie completed eighty-six consecutive repetitions for rope jumping yesterday. Today she completed only seventy-three.
How many repetitions did she fell behind?

While playing a video game Ned lost thirteen lives. Now he has seventy lives.
How many lives did Ned have at the start?

Will was picking up sticks from his yard. He picked up thirty-eight but there were still sixty-one left.
How many sticks were originally in the yard?

Gwen prepared ninety-eight books to sell in the flea market. After the activity ended she had ninety-six books left.
How many did she sell?

A baker made ninety cakes. If he sold eighty-three of them,
how many cakes would the baker still have?

A chef had seventy-seven cherries. If he used sixty of them to make a pie,
how many cherries would he still have?

Carol had eighty-one pieces of paper in her folder. After a week she had thirty-eight left.
How many pieces did she use in the week?

Isabel had ninety DS games. If she gave eighty-seven to her friend,
how many would she have left?

Maria stored ninety-three cloves of garlic in the kitchen. She used eighty-six for roast chicken for dinner.
How many cloves of garlic does she have left?

A store has thirty-five shirts. If they sold thirty of them,
how many shirts would they have?

Paige used three of her pencils. Now she has ninety-one pencils.
How many pencils did Paige have to begin with?

Gwen's hair was twenty-eight centimeters long. After a haircut it was seventeen centimeters long.
How much did she cut off?

Adam picked thirty-five strawberries. After eating some, he had thirty-three left.
How many strawberries did Adam eat?

Janet had eighty-five paper clips on the desk when she woke up in the morning. Before going to bed, she found there were twenty-six left.
How many paper clips did she use today?

At the zoo a cage had sixty-eight snakes. If forty-two were hiding,
how many snakes were not hiding?

Olivia gave her cat two cheese cubes. Now Olivia has ninety-eight cheese cubes left.
How many cheese cubes did Olivia have originally?

A clown had eighty-two balloons. After a party he had sixteen left.
How many balloons did he use at the party?

A pet store had eighty-five gerbils. If they sold sixty-nine of them,
how many would they have left?

For Halloween Debby and her sister combined the candy they received. Debby had 32 pieces of candy while her sister had 42. If they ate 35 pieces the first night,
how many pieces do they have left?

A pet store had 13 siamese cats and 5 house cats. During a sale they sold 10 cats.
How many cats do they have left?

Luke was trying to expand his game collection. He bought 2 games from a friend and bought 2 more at a garage sale. If 2 of the games didn't work,
how many good games did he end up with?

Oliver had to wash 39 short sleeve shirts and 47 long sleeve shirts before school. If he had only washed 20 of them by the time school started,
how many did he not wash?

While on vacation, Debby took 24 pictures at the zoo and 12 at the museum. If she later deleted 14 of the pictures,
how many pictures from her vacation did she still have?

Zoe bought two coloring books. One had 44 pictures and the other had 44. After one week she had already colored 20 of the pictures.
How many pictures does she still have to color?

Faye and her mom were picking carrots from their garden. Faye picked 23 and her mother picked 5. If only 12 of the carrots were good,
how many bad carrots did they have?

At the schools book fair Sam bought 13 adventure books and 17 mystery books. If 15 of the books were used,
how many new books did he buy?

Amy had 26 music files and 36 video files on her flash drive. If she deleted 48 of the files,
how many files were still on her flash drive?

Emily was playing a trivia game. In the first round she scored 16 points and in the second round she scored 33 points. In the last round she lost 48 points.
How many points did she have at the end of the game?

Paige had 43 math problems and 12 science problems for homework. If she finished 44 of the problems at school,
how many problems did she have to do for homework?

Janet picked 4 tulips and 11 roses to make flower bouquets. If she only used 11 of the flowers though,
how many extra flowers did Janet pick?

Edward started his own lawn mowing business. In the spring he made 2 dollars mowing lawns and in the summer he made 27 dollars. If he had to spend 5 dollars buying supplies,
how much money did he end up with?

For the school bake sale Amy made pastries. She baked 15 cupcakes and 48 cookies. After the sale she had 12 to take back home.
How many pastries did she sell?

While shopping, Maria bought 35 green towels and 21 white towels. If she gave her mother 34 of them,
how many towels did Maria end up with?

There were 17 girls and 32 boys trying out for the schools basketball team. If only 10 of them got called back,
how many students didn't make the cut?

A waiter at 'The Greasy Spoon' restaurant had 39 customers to wait on. During the lunch rush he added another 12 customers. If 49 of the customers didn't leave him a tip,
how many customers did leave a tip?

The school cafeteria ordered 25 red apples and 17 green apples for students lunches. But, if only 10 students wanted fruit,
how many extra did the cafeteria end up with?

At the arcade, Jerry won 29 tickets playing 'whack a mole' and 17 tickets playing 'skee ball'. If he spent 12 of his tickets on a hat,
how many tickets does Jerry have left?

Cody had 45 dollars. For his birthday he got 9 more dollars but spent 19 on a new game.
How much money does he have now?

A grocery store had forty-nine bottles of regular soda and thirty-five bottles of diet soda.
How many bottles did they have total?

While playing a game Sam had ninety-two points. If he scored another three points,
how many points would he have total?

In the first half of a trivia game Kaleb scored forty-three points. In the second half he scored twenty-three points.
How many points did he score total?

Mike owned sixty-four baseball cards. For his birthday he got eighteen more.
How many cards does Mike have total?

For a party Henry spent forty-five dollars on food and thirty-three dollars on drinks.
How much did Henry spend total?

A restaurant sold seventy-seven sodas in the morning and nineteen in the afternoon.
How many sodas did they sell total?

A store has fifty-six shirts. Later they got in eleven more shirts.
How many shirts does the store have now?

Bianca spent twenty-two minutes drawing at school and nineteen minutes drawing at home.
How many minutes total did she spend drawing?

There were sixty-one people in line at lunch when twenty-two more got in line.
How many people were there total in line?

A fast food restaurant sold fifty-eight small hotdogs and twenty-one large hotdogs.
How many hotdogs did they sell total?

Henry had $54. Later he sold some of his old toys and got another $2.
How much money does he have total?

An aquarium had ten fish in it. Later they added three fish.
How many fish are in the aquarium now?

Isabel had sixty-eight pieces of candy. Her friend gave her twenty-five more pieces.
How many pieces of candy did Isabel have total?

Maria had fifty sheets of paper in her desk and forty-one more in her backpack.
How many did she have total?

On Facebook Debby had sixty-three photos of her friends and twenty-three photos of her family.
How many photos did she have total?

Adam had seventy-nine dollars saved up. After doing some chores his mother gave him another thirteen dollars.
How much money does he have total?

Debby received twenty-one text messages before noon and another eighteen after noon.
How many text messages did Debby receive total?

At the fair Amy started with thirty-three tickets and then bought twenty-one more.
How many tickets did Amy have total?

Mike collected seventy-one cans to recycle on Monday and twenty-seven more on Tuesday.
How many cans did Mike collect all together?

A baker already had seventy-eight cakes but made nine extra.
How many cakes did the baker have total?

A pet store had sixty-four birds that talked and thirteen that didn't.
How many birds did the pet store have total?

At the zoo Zoe took sixty-seven pictures. If her sister took another seventeen pictures,
how many did they take total?

At the arcade Henry had won fifty-eight tickets. Later he won forty more tickets.
How many tickets did Henry have total?

Katie had seventy-two DS games and her friend had twenty-three games.
How many do they have total?

Sam was playing basketball with his friend. Sam scored seventy-five points and his friend scored twelve points.
How many points did they score total?

While exercising Paul did fifty-nine push-ups in the morning and thirty-eight more in the afternoon.
How many push-ups did Paul do total?

A farmer planted twenty seeds on Wednesday and another two seeds on Thursday.
How many seeds did he plant total?

For Halloween Faye scored 47 pieces of candy. She ate 25 pieces the first night and then her sister gave her 40 more pieces.
How many pieces of candy does Faye have now?

A waiter had 47 customers to wait on. If 41 customers left and he got another 20 customers,
how many customers would he have?

For the school bake sale Katie made 26 cupcakes. If she sold 20 of them and then made 20 more,
how many cupcakes would she have?

Adam had 5 dollars. At the store he spent $2 on a new game. If he got another 5 dollars for his allowance,
how much money does he have now?

Tiffany was playing a video game and had 43 lives. In a hard part of the game she lost 14 lives. If she got 27 more lives in the next level,
how many lives would she have?

A teacher had 38 worksheets to grade. If she graded 4, but then another 15 were turned in,
how many worksheets would she have to grade?

A book store had 4 books in the bargin bin. If they sold 3 books, but then put 10 more in the bin,
how many books would be in the bin?

Bianca had 45 coloring books. If she gave away 6 of them, but then bought 20 more,
how many would she have total?

Adam had 33 books. If he sold 11 of them and used the money he earned to buy 23 new books,
how many books would Adam have?

At the fair there were 10 people in line for the bumper cars. If 2 of them got tired of waiting and left and 2 more got in line,
how many people would be in line?

In fourth grade there were 35 students at the start of the year. During the year 10 students left and 10 new students came to school.
How many students were in fourth grade at the end?

Robin had 30 songs on her mp3 player. If she deleted 8 old songs from it and then added 10 new songs,
how many songs does she have on her mp3 player?

The school cafeteria had 17 apples. If they used 2 to make lunch for the students and then bought 23 more,
how many apples would they have?

Nancy picked 12 carrots from her garden. If she threw out 2 of them and then picked 21 more the next day,
how many carrots would she have total?

John had 33 socks. If he threw away 19 old ones that didn't fit and bought 13 new ones,
how many socks would he have?

Zoe had 42 bottles of water in her fridge. If she drank 25 of them and then bought 30 more,
how many bottles would she have?

Luke had 48 dollars in January. By March he had spent 11 dollars. If he got another 21 dollars from his mom,
how much money would he have?

A florist had 50 roses. If she sold 15 of them and then later picked 21 more,
how many roses would she have?

At the arcade Dave won 11 tickets. If he spent 5 tickets on a beanie and later won 10 more tickets,
how many would he have?

A store had 40 oranges in a bin. If they threw away 25 of the old ones and put 21 new ones in the bin,
how many would be in the bin?
